attributes.additional_details:
The Leave Voters won 52% (17,410,742) of the votes While the Remain Voters won 48% (16,141,241) 

We think this is fair we never got a 2nd vote in the general elections so neither should they!
attributes.background:
With the EU referendum leave vote winning 52% from the 23rd June 2016 votes, we would like to be able to keep the decision without a 2nd EU referendum being made.
We think it's unfair that the remain voters are trying to stop the option to leave so that we have to stay within the EU.
